meanings.definition: The state or quality of being permanent.
meanings.sent1: The permanentnesses of the mountain range impressed the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The permanentnesses of the ink on the paper ensured the document's longevity.
meanings.sent3: The permanentnesses of the marker on the whiteboard made the teacher's drawing last forever.
meanings.sent4: The permanentnesses of the stone walls in the ancient castle whispered tales of time.
meanings.sent5: The permanentnesses of the oak tree's roots symbolized strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: The condition of lasting or enduring indefinitely.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the permanentnesses of the sunset in her painting.
meanings.sent2: The permanentnesses of the friendship between the two neighbors brought them joy for years.
meanings.sent3: The permanentnesses of the ice cream cone in the sun turned into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The permanentnesses of the melody lingered in the air long after the music stopped.
meanings.sent5: The permanentnesses of the starlight filled the night sky with a sense of eternity.
